questions.question_text: When working on a new product, what should an agile team do to ensure alignment with external stakeholders?

On an agile project, it is important to identify and engage business stakeholders throughout the project and to ensure the team understands the stakeholders' business needs. Which option supports this idea?

choices.A: A project charter should be established and reviewed throughout the project life cycle to ensure the accurate documentation of stakeholders’ interests and expectations.
choices.D: A user story should be created for all key stakeholders to list their individual business objectives and needs.
choices.C: An Agile Manifesto should be created to document the project stakeholders, their desired outcomes, and identified risks.
choices.B: A product backlog should be created to list the project requirements from all of the project stakeholders.

comments.content:
Centralized Requirements: The product backlog serves as a single source of truth for all project requirements, ensuring that nothing is overlooked.
Prioritization: Allows for prioritizing the requirements based on stakeholder needs and business value, ensuring that the most important features are developed first.
Continuous Engagement: Facilitates ongoing engagement with stakeholders as the backlog is continuously reviewed and updated throughout the project.
Transparency: Provides transparency to all stakeholders about what is being worked on and what is planned for future iterations.
Flexibility: Supports the agile principle of responding to change by allowing for easy adjustments to the backlog as new information and feedback are received.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Creating a product backlog is a fundamental agile practice that helps in capturing and prioritizing the requirements from all stakeholders. It ensures that the team has a clear understanding of what needs to be developed and aligns the project with the stakeholders' business needs.

questions.question_text:
A high-profile project team is struggling to meet planned velocity. During a retrospective, the team agreed that their lack of experience in the technology resulted in an excess of rework.

What should be done to resolve this challenge?

choices.A: Increase the duration of iterations to minimize the frequency of priority changes that are distracting the team.
choices.D: Implement a spike to enhance creativity by experimenting with new techniques and process ideas in order to discover more efficient and effective ways of working.
choices.C: Increase the level of effort in testing to ensure that all defects are identified and properly documented so they can be resolved before the end of the iteration.
choices.B: Reduce the duration of iterations so that the product owner can reprioritize work to ensure business value alignment.

comments.content:
A. Increasing the duration of iterations would not necessarily solve the team's problem related to a lack of technical experience. Agile promotes shorter iterations to foster quick feedback and adaptability.

B. Shorter iterations alone will not resolve the team's lack of experience with the technology, which is causing the rework. Reprioritization may help focus on the most valuable features, but it won’t address the root cause of technical challenges.

C. While increased testing can help catch defects, the core issue is the team’s lack of technical expertise. Testing doesn’t solve the fundamental problem of rework due to technical gaps.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This approach allows the team to dedicate time to learning and experimenting with the new technology, which can help them overcome their lack of experience and reduce rework in future iterations.

Detailed Points:
Focused Learning: A spike provides a time-boxed opportunity for the team to focus on learning and experimenting with the new technology.
Problem Solving: Helps the team identify and resolve specific technical challenges that are causing rework.
Innovation: Encourages creativity and the discovery of more efficient and effective ways of working.
Reduced Rework: By gaining a better understanding of the technology, the team can reduce the amount of rework required in future iterations.
Improved Velocity: As the team becomes more proficient with the technology, their ability to meet planned velocity is likely to improve.

questions.question_text: During a retrospective, the team agrees that they have limited competence in using a newly introduced tool. What should the team do?

The agile lead is told by executive leadership that the team needs to work faster because the release date has been moved up three months. The agile lead communicates the updated timeline to the team. One of the junior team members objects and feels the timeline is unrealistic.

What should the junior team member do?

comments.content:
B. Follow the agile lead's instructions: While following instructions is important, blindly doing so without addressing concerns can lead to burnout, decreased morale, and potential project failure if the timeline is indeed unrealistic.
C. Increase the time worked to meet objectives: Simply increasing work hours is not a sustainable solution and can lead to burnout and decreased productivity. It does not address the root cause of the concern.
D. Speak to all team members about the concerns: While discussing with team members can be helpful, it is more effective to first address the concern with the agile lead who has the authority to make decisions and adjustments. Speaking to all team members without a clear plan can lead to confusion and unnecessary stress.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Open Communication: It is essential for team members to communicate openly with their agile lead about any concerns they have regarding project timelines or other issues. This helps in maintaining transparency and trust within the team.
Feasibility Assessment: The agile lead can assess the feasibility of the new timeline and discuss potential adjustments or additional resources that might be needed to meet the new deadline.
Risk Management: By voicing concerns, the junior team member helps in identifying potential risks early, which can be managed more effectively.
Support and Guidance: The agile lead can provide support and guidance to the junior team member, helping them understand the rationale behind the new timeline and how the team plans to achieve it.

Selected Answer: D
option D aligns with the principle of self-organization in agile teams, where team members should communicate openly with each other about any concerns or challenges they face. By discussing concerns with the entire team first, the junior team member can ensure that everyone is aware of the issue, gather different perspectives, and collectively decide on the best course of action. This approach fosters a sense of shared responsibility and collaboration.
